meanings.definition: The quality or state of being servile.
meanings.sent1: Her servilenesses towards her boss were evident in how she always agreed with everything he said.
meanings.sent2: The servilenesses of the butler were apparent in his constant bowing and scraping.
meanings.sent3: The dog's servilenesses towards its owner included wagging its tail constantly and fetching slippers.
meanings.sent4: The servilenesses of the waves as they bowed to the shore reminded him of his own subservience to authority.
meanings.sent5: The servilenesses of the character in the play were exaggerated to emphasize his lack of independence.

meanings.definition: The behavior or attitude of a servant; servility.
meanings.sent1: His servilenesses in the presence of his master were so extreme that he would do anything asked of him without question.
meanings.sent2: The servilenesses of the maid were evident in how she always put her employer's needs above her own.
meanings.sent3: The cat's servilenesses towards its owner included bringing gifts of dead mice to the doorstep.
meanings.sent4: The servilenesses of the wind as it obeyed the commands of the storm were both impressive and terrifying.
meanings.sent5: The servilenesses of the character in the novel made him a pitiable figure, constantly seeking approval from others.
